DOC.brief_summary: This study evaluate effect American Indian/Alaska Native ( AI/AN ) adaptation It 's Your Game…Keep It Real ( IYG ) intervention , relative comparison condition sexual behavior outcome psychosocial variable middle school age youth ( 12 - 14 year old ) . The original IYG program design student Houston middle school help student delay sexual initiation sexually active , use condom contraception . The present study adapt exist IYG program AI/AN youth cohort ; original IYG curriculum transfer web-based format modify incorporate additional culturally-relevant component . The primary hypothesis test : ( 1 ) student receive web-based curriculum delay sexual activity relative receive standard care . The major dependent variable proportion student initiate sexual activity . Secondary hypothesis examine effect web-based curriculum specific type sex psychosocial variable relate sexual risk-taking behavior . This project also examine effect intervention proportion student sexually active , number time student engage unprotected sexual intercourse , student ' number sexual partner .
DOC.brief_title: Internet-Based Sexual Health Education Middle School Native American Youth
DOC.detailed_description: The goal four year research project adapt evaluate effectiveness Internet-based HIV/STI , pregnancy prevention curriculum American Indian/Alaska Native ( AI/AN ) middle school-aged youth ( 12-14 year ) . This curriculum adapt successful , Internet-accessible , prevention program , It 's Your Game…Keep Real ( IYG ) . During year 1 ( Fall 2010 Spring 2011 ) project , study team test usability exist IYG program , perform assessment exist program cultural IYG intervention . In year 2 ( begin Fall 2011 ) , project team plan initiate complete development cultural-adapted IYG intervention AI/AN youth ( IYG-AI/AN ) . Starting year 3 ( Fall 2012 ) , study efficacy trial commence evaluate effectiveness IYG-AI/AN sexual behavior psychosocial determinant behavior among AI/AN youth three region ( Alaska , Pacific Northwest , include Idaho , Oregon , Washington state , Arizona ) relative comparison condition . Recruitment sit middle school Boys Girls Clubs ( BGCs ) , identify affiliation Alaska Native Tribal Health Consortium ( ANTHC ) , Pacific Northwest Tribal Epicenter ( Epicenter ) Inter Tribal Council Arizona ( ITCA ) . Randomization occur regionally , site ( school BGCs ) level , one two condition : IYG-AI/AN comparison condition . The comparison condition consist two web-based educational program unrelated sexual health . The IYG-AI/AN intervention compare comparison condition . The efficacy trial continue 16 month year 4 ( 2013 ) . The primary hypothesis test : ( 1 ) youth receive IYG-AI/AN intervention delay sexual activity relative receive comparison condition . The major dependent variable proportion AI/AN youth initiate sexual activity ( vaginal , oral , anal sex ) . Secondary hypothesis examine effect intervention specific type sex ( e.g. , vaginal , oral , anal ) psychosocial variable youth intention , knowledge , self-efficacy , attitude , perceive norm related sexual risk-taking behavior . Secondary hypothesis also examine effect intervention proportion AI/AN youth sexually active , occurrence unprotected sexual intercourse number sexual partner among AI/AN youth .
DOC.criteria: American Indian Alaska Native descent and/or tribal affiliation Youth age 1214 attend regular class regional middle school youth attend afterschool program and/or Boys Girls Clubs Englishspeaking Youth American Indian Alaska Native descent Any physical mental condition would inhibit ability complete survey use computer program , cognitive impairment , motor disorder ( e.g . quadriplegia ) , learn difficulty psychiatric/behavioral problem ( e.g . autism , attention deficit disorder ) Students informed survey intervention material available English ask consider comfort level participate study
